Hellboy.Action: Smiles at the camera while bounding down the street with his weapon.
Blows open the door with a massive ball of fire, causing alarm.
Greets Abe and Manning casually despite being on fire and injured.
Yells at Liz, 'Well- I'm not afraid of you!'
Bounding down a city street confidently with his high-caliber weapon, looking straight at the camera with a smile.
Causes a massive explosion that nearly tears off a steel door to enter his room.
Lies on the floor smoking and aflame after the explosion, suggesting a reckless or careless approach.
Clearly knows and defends his personal taste and collection of music formats with confidence.
Casually points out the location of Liz's toothbrush amidst clutter, showing awareness of his environment.
Exhibits playful but decisive attitude when the alarm sounds, showing readiness and enthusiasm.
Holds the door open for Liz in a courteous and gentlemanly manner despite tense situation, indicating social competence and confidence.
Holds the door open for Liz, showing polite and considerate behavior.
Promises to be careful and use discretion on a mission, giving his word sincerely.
Responds to Liz's sarcastic guffaw with a glare and a sarcastic comment, showing mild irritation.
Uses a playful nickname for Liz ('babe') despite her objection, then immediately corrects himself.
Whispers to Liz that he will clean the place up, even the bathroom, showing consideration for their shared space.
Jokes awkwardly calling Liz 'babe' and quickly tries to correct himself when Liz objects, indicating a friendly, informal relationship and respect for her feelings.
Asks about the cats with concern, showing care and attachment to Liz's pets.
Communicates cautiously with teammates over intercom, staying aware of surroundings.
Prepares a pair of lever-action shotguns hastily as wall bulges and cracks, reacting quickly to emerging threat.
Attempts to lighten the mood with teasing banter despite tense situation.
Shows some confusion when Liz points out the problem, asking unclear questions.
Asks Abe what the creatures are, showing concern and engagement.
Reacts with mild disgust ('Aw, crap') upon realizing the floor is covered with excrement, showing honest, down-to-earth behavior.
Shoots to blow open a massive hole to investigate unknown sounds.
Asks Abe what the creatures are, showing uncertainty.
Mistakenly thinks the floor covering is a thick rug rather than noticing it is a layer of feces.
Warns Agent Marble not to approach the little creature.
Intervenes quickly when he sees Agent Marble approaching the Fairy creatures, warning him with 'No, don't-'
Protects another agent from swarming creatures despite being attacked himself.
Panics temporarily but immediately searches for and tries to save Liz amidst danger.
Has a 'moment of silent communion' looking deep into Liz's eyes, showing trust and connection.
Protects another agent by stepping into danger, fights off swarming creatures with shotguns despite overwhelming odds.
Shows sudden panic when he can’t immediately locate Liz, revealing momentary loss of composure.
Locates Liz in time, establishes quick silent communication to encourage her, facilitating her to unleash her power.
Protects Liz and Abe by taking on the attacking creatures himself, refusing to let them fight alone.
Uses extreme measures (pulling pins on multiple grenades attached to him) to defeat enemies, risking his own life.
Shoots attacking fairies to protect the crowd calmly and efficiently.
Grins and shrugs when confronted by press and cameras after conflict.
Efficiently shoots a group of attacking fairies, including one mid-air, and calmly handles a last creature by plucking it off his coat.
Grins and shrugs when seen by the press and Manning, showing nonchalance in a tense situation.
Grins confidently during a TV interview and signs an autograph, showing self-assurance and control over public perception.
Sits down next to Liz and casually interacts, popping a can of beer
Jokes lightly about a gas pocket on TV, showing humor and ease
Shows lightheartedness in responding to insults and hate mail indirectly (e.g., 'Ungodly freaks-? Us?')
Ignores tensions around him and continues with casual, friendly banter
Casually pops open a beer and confidently asserts he did good on a task and looked good doing it.
Dismisses the seriousness of a gas pocket situation with a laugh.
Asks Manning if he no longer trusts him, showing concern about their relationship.
Expresses distrust toward Germans based on personal feelings.
Questions Manning confidently about the change in leadership and his own role, showing engagement and some assertiveness.
Expresses distrust and discomfort with new leadership (Kraus) based on nationality and personal bias.
Nudges Abe playfully while trying to fish for an amulet to help with memory recall.
Glowers at Johann Kraus when he bows to Liz, showing annoyance or jealousy.
Whispers a technical observation about an 'open face' and attempts to help Abe fish for an amulet, showing awareness and initiative.
Expresses skepticism about memory recall from dead creatures but still tries to assist.
Questions Johann's unfamiliar ability by asking 'What are you doing?'.
Leers at the fairy that snarls and bares its teeth at him, responding with irritation about his tail being chewed off
Comments with some sympathy that the fairy 'doesn't look too good' as it becomes weak and collapses
Uses humor to lighten the mood by saying 'Wow- You have that effect on me too' as fairy collapses
Leers at the fairy and reacts quickly to its aggressive behavior, showing confidence and readiness.
Responds with sarcastic humor ('Wow- You have that effect on me too.') in a tense moment, showing composure under pressure.
Does not take immediate action to help the fairy when it weakens and collapses, relying on Johann's expertise instead.
Jokes teasingly about Johann's accent, showing casual, informal interaction.
Calls Johann a moron and a jerk but in a somewhat playful, bantering tone with Abe and Liz.
Raises his hand to ask a question, showing engagement and attention to detail.
Questions Johann's accent in a blunt, sarcastic way, possibly undermining group cohesion.
Criticizes the plan and Johann's attitude, but shows strategic awareness by staying behind to think deeply.
Acknowledges receiving hate mail and responds with 'We'll deal with it. Together.'
Asks Liz if something else is bothering her and encourages her to talk about it.
Expresses frustration about the garbage truck making the wrong statement about who they are.
Shields Liz from a barrage of thrown eggs, demonstrating protective instincts and calm under pressure.
Corrects a reporter's insult calmly, indicating confidence and self-awareness.
Seething gaze at the hostile crowd but does not escalate the situation, showing restraint and situational awareness.
Rolls his eyes at Johann's earnest plea, calling it 'sooo corny'
Shows surprise and curiosity when others applaud, asking 'What-?? What-??'
Encourages team vigilance by actively looking through the Schufften glasses and calling out when spotting something
Uses specialized equipment (Schufften glasses) to search intelligently for a target, shows focus and technical understanding.
Dismisses an emotional or serious appeal by rolling his eyes and calling it corny, which could indicate a lack of tact or social awareness.
Jokingly suggests bowling and then a beer to lighten the mood while pursuing the bag lady
Uses a friendly, casual tone with Johann and Abe despite tense circumstances
Fumbles unsuccessfully trying to adjust his glasses while Johann and Abe proceed competently.
Quickly offers to take care of the locking mechanism by force without considering consequences.
Defers to Johann's expertise when he is corrected and lets Johann handle the lock's mechanism, showing trust in team skills.
Smiles and greets the faceless Cave Berserker, 'Hiya, Chuck-'
Dismisses Abe's urgent call with 'Not now, Abe.'
Smiles back confidently at a threatening Cave Berserker instead of reacting with fear.
Dismisses Abe's urgent call on the intercom, indicating focus on the current task.
Bats away panhandlers pulling at his belt.
Confronts the berserker creature to protect the shop owner.
Roughly interrogates the shop owner by slapping him around.
Bats away panhandlers assertively, maintaining control in a potentially distracting situation.
Calmly approaches a threatening creature and defeats it with a single, precise uppercut showing physical prowess and confidence.
Interrogates the shop owner effectively, using intimidation to elicit information quickly.
Immediately checks his belt locator to find Abe, showing situational awareness and use of tools.
Immediately checks on Abe after seeing his locator flashing, shows concern by repeatedly trying to communicate and asking if Abe is in trouble.
Attempts to communicate with Abe promptly when his locator light flashes and remains concerned about Abe's wellbeing after losing contact.
Does not immediately intervene or visibly react to the assault on Abe by the trolls, relying solely on communication over the intercom.
Bursts in energetically, leaping over fallen guards to protect allies.
Swats narcotic bugs aggressively around the princess, showing protectiveness.
Disrupts a formal meeting with a loud and unrefined entrance, causing discomfort to the princess and Abe.
Bursts in aggressively, leaping over fallen guards and swats away narcotic bugs like mosquitoes.
Disregards the presence of royalty initially, prompting Abe to urge him to apologize, showing a lack of social tact.
Expresses doubt and caution about Princess Nuala's claim of allegiance, requiring proof before trust.
Produces an ancient seal as evidence to challenge the Princess's allegiance.
Asks Johann for clarification about the Golden Army after hearing the Princess's explanation.
Expresses willingness to help despite the Princess's warning that intervention will bring trouble by saying, 'Good, I like trouble.'
Confidently embraces the potential for trouble when warned against intervention, showing readiness to face challenges.
Relies on others for guidance in navigating the Troll Market's narrow passages and unfamiliar alleys.
Unclenches his fists and stretches his neck calmly upon pressure from the crowd.
Erupts from the floorboards fighting clawing monsters to protect others.
Starts up the stairs despite guards blocking his path, showing determination.
Unclenches fists and stretches neck calmly when challenged, then starts up the stairs to confront guards blocking his path.
Punches his way free from a crowd of clawing monsters erupting from floorboards in a bowling alley.
Gets dragged back by the tail by another character (Wink) while fighting, indicating momentary loss of control.
Appears to beat an old lady but is revealed to be protecting her from a misunderstanding captured by the camera prism.
Winks and fights off a troll, eventually vanquishing it by ripping its iron mace off and throwing it away.
Appears to be beating an old lady mercilessly, causing reporters to think he has lost his mind.
Although misunderstood by onlookers and media, remains focused and effective in combat during the street fight.
Allows a misunderstanding to escalate in public without clear immediate clarification, leading to negative perception.
Catches a grenade and inspects it, jokes with the Prince by mocking him ('It's a dud, your royal assness')
Responds calmly to Abe’s urgency despite the chaos ('Abe, please, get a grip')
Reluctantly follows Abe’s demand to collect the jumping beans, showing willingness to cooperate
Catches the grenade mid-air and inspects it closely instead of panicking.
Calmly identifies the grenade as a dud initially and mocks the Prince's attempt.
Reluctantly follows Abe's urgent order to pick up the jumping beans despite initial skepticism.
Fails to catch the seventh jumping bean before it falls into the manhole.
Maintains composure and tells Abe to get a grip during the emergence of the huge tree.
Approaches the massive tree with fascination, expressing wonder ('Whoa. Just like the story books').
Spots the prince knocking on the tree and reacts with mild concern ('Jeez did you have to do that??').
Approaches the massive tree with fascination and addresses the prince, trying to understand the situation.
Does not effectively prevent the summoning of the Elemental or control the crowd before the threat emerges.
Praises the Yrdrig with 'Good dog.'
Engages the Elemental directly to protect the Princess, playfully adopting a kung fu pose.
Confronts the Elemental directly, humorously adopts a kung fu pose showing confidence and readiness to engage the enemy.
Quickly seeks cover by ducking into an open window when the Elemental pulls down the fire escape ladder, demonstrating situational awareness and quick reflexes.
Runs through a dilapidated kitchen and corridor while being pursued by a destructive Elemental, effectively evading destruction and maintaining composure under pressure.
Tries to communicate with the Elemental in a casual, somewhat humorous manner ('What now, Big Boy? You get a ladder?')
Demonstrates concern and attempts to contact his friends (asks about Abe and Liz, tries to coordinate)
Muttering and continuing alone when no answer on radio; appears a bit frustrated or isolated
Resists the Prince's persuasion and maintains his stance firmly despite being captured by the Elemental.
Struggles while held by the Elemental but does not immediately escape or turn the situation to his advantage.
Hits the Elemental decisively to stop it, protecting the Prince and city.
Observes Abe, Liz, and Johann embracing from a distance, feeling jealous and alone.
Focuses intensely on target practice alone, somewhat isolated.
Tells Johann to stay away from Liz and to not talk to her, shows protective but curt behavior
Engages in playful, teasing banter with Johann, including mock threats
Engages in confident, assertive banter, clearly sets boundaries regarding Johann's interactions with Liz, and asserts dominance to maintain team dynamics.
Allows Johann to accidentally knock Hellboy's loader onto the floor, indicating a momentary carelessness or lack of focus.
Apologizes to Johann after accidentally breaking his glass skull, expresses concern and offers to get help.
Hits Johann over the head after being teased about being slow.
Cracks Johann over the head with his massive fist, surprising him with his strength.
Gets repeatedly hit by metal doors like a pinball after hitting Johann; wobbles and sits trying to stand showing momentary disorientation.
Admits he got carried away and apologizes, trying to get help for Johann.
Analyzes enemy's personality quickly, identifying an opponent as an egomaniac and seeing through him.
Shows awareness of media portrayal and commercialization of self through cartoons, cereal, and video games.
Attempts to control conversation and switch TV channels to a more favorable program confidently.
Makes a light joke about the horns and himself, displaying social confidence.
Ignores Liz’s reluctance about appearing on a TV show, shows less sensitivity to team concerns.
Provides a seemingly trivial fact (about orchestra playing during commercial breaks) sourced from TV Guide, showing a small amount of intelligence or trivia knowledge.
Chuckles at the dog in ballerina costume on TV, showing lightheartedness and ability to appreciate simple joys.
Proposes an idea enthusiastically ('We should do this-') despite Liz expressing doubts, indicating friendliness and engagement.
Watches Johann and Liz showing mutual support from behind a glass door, then steps away quietly with a six-pack in hand.
Admits to Abe that he and Liz had a fight, showing openness about his vulnerability.
Approaches Abe and engages in light teasing about listening to Barry Manilow, showing friendly, playful interaction.
Pops a beer, puts on the song Abe loves, and joins him in singing, showing support despite teasing.
Makes a sarcastic, slightly mocking comment about Abe's love and choice of music.
Hits the eject button on Abe's CD player and selects a different CD, showing decisiveness and control.
Responds skeptically and somewhat sarcastically to Abe's emotional state and choice of music, showing quick wit and emotional awareness.
Pops a beer and sighs heavily while listening to sentimental music, showing a moment of emotional vulnerability rather than active problem-solving.
Nods agreement when Abe talks about missing their father and gives a brief but meaningful response, indicating understanding and reliability.
Sings along tearfully and emotionally with Abe, demonstrating emotional connection but not necessarily competence in terms of skill or intelligence.
Jokes with Manning and Abe about ditching the garbage truck for a new Hummer, showing a relaxed and friendly attitude toward teammates.
Suggests ditching the old vehicle (garbage truck) in favor of new, more suitable ones (Hummers), showing practicality and confidence in improving their operational capabilities.
Signs a photo for a fan with a flourish, offers a personalized autograph
Scowls at the fan and makes a threatening joke about tracking him down if the autograph appears on e-Bay
Signs autographs for fans with a personal touch and a confident flourish.
Scowls at fan and threatens to find them if autograph is resold, showing assertiveness but potentially poor public relations.
Grins and explains scars with stories behind them, shows openness and engagement.
Abruptly gets up and approaches Johann and Liz after seeing them talking.
Responds to Johann's advice about hinting at relationship with sarcasm and defiance ('Thanks a bunch. I'll decide that.' and 'It's a love story. They'll lap it up.')
Smiles in satisfaction at a friendly joke about Liz's nickname Sparky.
Responds awkwardly and hesitantly when asked about his relationship with Liz on live TV, showing some vulnerability.
Explodes with rage, bellowing and physically ripping up the desk and throwing it through the backdrop when provoked.
Quickly jumps out of the vehicle and immediately heads into the building upon noticing dead agents and alarms, showing decisive and confident response to the emergency.
Leads the team calmly through chaotic and dangerous corridors with wounded and confused personnel around, indicating leadership and situational awareness.
Shouts a warning to Abe to get back to prevent him from being hurt.
Stops Abe from attacking impulsively to protect him.
Steps forward to challenge the Prince to protect others.
Refuses to arm himself with a flail despite suggestion, opting for direct combat.
Engages in brutal combat that results unintentionally in the Princess being hurt.
Turns momentarily distracted by Abe's plea to stop harming the Prince.
Ignores Abe's warning and allows the fight to continue, resulting in him being seriously wounded.
Engages in combat effectively, landing brutal combinations against the Prince and his trolls.
Momentarily distracted by Abe's warning, which allows the Prince to attack and injure him.
Collapses due to a spear tip lodged in his chest, showing limits in physical endurance and vulnerability.
Urgently insists on doing something to help Red and stop the Rebellion by going after the Prince
Does not appear in this excerpt nor takes direct action or shows input in the crisis moments.
Leans weakly against doorframe, appears physically or emotionally compromised, not actively taking charge in the situation.
Reassures Liz with confidence despite his weakness by saying 'Don't worry, Sparky- It's all going to be ALRIGHT-'
Weakly groans and asks where they are, indicating a moment of vulnerability and lack of immediate capability.
Allows the Goblin to uncover his wound and the spear tip, trusting others to assess the situation and manage the danger.
Relies on his comrades (Liz, Abe, Johann) to intervene and protect him from harm and to help after injury.
Collapses into a deep coma after being speared and shows no immediate reaction or defense.
Survives a severe injury and eventually regains consciousness, indicating resilience.
Smiles wanly at Angel of Death despite difficult circumstances.
Grabs Liz's hand, apologizes for causing attention, shows concern for their relationship.
Expresses insecurity by asking Liz if he is a good man, seeking reassurance.
Mentions being willing to turn his back on the world but wants Liz to stay with him.
Recovers from injury and calmly sips tea while engaging in an emotional conversation with Liz, showing composure and self-awareness.
Expresses vulnerability and self-doubt by questioning if he is a good man, showing emotional depth but momentary uncertainty.
Refuses to rest and insists on keeping an eye on Johann and Liz, showing protectiveness and commitment.
Engages in violent combat with Wink, showing physical aggression.
Grips the chain, pulls the creature close, then lifts and throws him overboard to stop the fight.
After being hit and wounded, signals to Abe to say nothing and urges moving on, showing stoicism and protecting others from worry.
Despite bleeding from an open wound, helps Johann turn the rusted lock underwater using his strength.
Pushes past others, insisting he's fine despite pain.
Jokes with the silent golden soldier, asking for gum.
Accidentally causes a crash by playing with the soldiers, then says 'Whoops...'
Pulls Liz aside to protect her from falling soldiers
Wipes his own wound casually and remains focused on the situation
Pulls Liz aside to protect her from charging soldiers, showing quick reaction and protective instinct.
Despite being wounded and bleeding, remains confident and verbally challenges the Prince, indicating resilience and confidence under pressure.
Tells Abe 'If we survive this, we need to talk,' showing concern for his friend and planning to address issues later.
Cuts off Abe when he is ranting about the Prince, prioritizing immediate safety over venting emotions.
Steps forward despite feeling dizzy and betrayed, quickly reacts to the threat by drawing his huge gun and firing at approaching mechanical soldiers.
Admits to Abe that they need to talk if they survive, showing awareness of strategic communication and trust in his team under pressure.
Chooses to engage and retreat tactically with his team when overwhelmed, rather than rashly charging the enemy.
Does not show signs of hesitation or confusion in critical moments; maintains focus on combat despite personal feelings of betrayal.
Rushes forward to fight the mechanical soldiers despite bleeding and wounds.
Groans but keeps fighting despite it being apparently futile.
Grabs nearest sword and challenges Prince Nuada to stop the relentless army, attempting to protect others by stepping forward.
Moves away from Abe when Abe pleads him not to proceed, showing some emotional distance or ignoring Abe's concerns.
Despite being wounded and repeatedly hit, Hellboy fights on and challenges Prince Nuada to stop the mechanical soldiers.
Gets thrown against the wall and collapses, unable to continue fighting effectively.
Holsters the Samaritan handgun and rushes forward giving it his best despite injury.
Grabs a sword and stands up to issue a direct challenge to the enemy command, showing initiative and confidence.
Moves away from Abe after his plea, potentially indicating a confidence in handling the situation but could be seen as ignoring advice or caution.
Fights the Prince despite physical weakness and the plea from Abe to stop attacking.
Raises sword in combat as a duty and rightful challenger, honoring the challenge instead of backing down.
Commands the Prince to raise his sword and accepts the challenge with confidence.
Summons last ounce of strength to drive the Prince back despite growing weakness.
Struggles physically as his sword grows heavy and muscles fail, putting him close to defeat.
Maintains composure and quickly takes advantage after the Princess's self-stabbing distraction to regain upper hand.
Disarms the Prince and points sword at his chest, declaring victory.
Acknowledges Manning's help and expresses appreciation.
Shrugs off his pack and prepares to quit, but then keeps his gun, showing conflicted commitment.
Sits close to Liz and Abe, listens and talks about settling down together, shows willingness to consider a home and family with Liz.
Makes a joking negative comment about milk, showing playful banter rather than harshness.
Engages in a calm, thoughtful conversation with Liz about their future, showing emotional awareness and openness to planning ahead.
Displays light-hearted confusion about the concept of 'growing' a baby, revealing some naivety or lack of familiarity with domestic matters.
